comment_data.body:
I think this'll need a `__Pyx_GOTREF(%s)` (in place of `__Pyx_INCREF` in the others) to pass our tests.

That's a no-op in a regular build, but when running with our "refnanny" tool it helps track the new reference.

             inc_dec = '--'

             inc_dec = '++'

-        code.putln(
-            "%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(%s, %s); __Pyx_INCREF(%s); %s%s; %s" % (

-                inc_dec,
-                # use the error label to avoid C compiler warnings if we only use it below
-                code.error_goto_if_neg('0', self.pos)
-                ))

+                "%s = Py%s_GetItemRef(%s, %s); %s%s; %s" % (

comment_data.body: We usually try to put special cases first just because it's easier if we need to add other special cases.

         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("if (likely(Py%s_CheckExact(sequence))) {" % sequence_types[0])
         for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):

comment_data.body:
This function is new in Py3.13a1 and needs a version guard.
See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/41ca16455188db806bfc7037058e8ecff2755e6c

This function is new in Py3.13a4 and needs a version guard.
See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/d0f1307580a69372611d27b04bbf2551dc85a1ef

That said, rather than repeating the "use GET_ITEM+INCREF or GetItemRef" decision in various places, it seems worth having an inline function that does the equivalent of "GET_ITEM+INCREF" efficiently in different environments.

EDIT: an inline function instead of a macro, because the latter wouldn't allow us to incref before returning the item.
I think this can go, becaise `PyList_GetItemRef` ends up being the same as this when `CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS` isn't defined.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8409,16 +8437,36 @@ def generate_special_parallel_unpacking_code(self, code, rhs, use_loop):
         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("if (likely(Py%s_CheckExact(sequence))) {" % sequence_types[0])
         for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):
-            code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
-                item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+            if sequence_types[0] == "List":
+                code.putln("#if !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.put_incref(item.result(), item.ctype())
+                code.putln("#else")
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GetItemRef(sequence, %d);" % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.putln("#endif")
+            else:  # Tuple
+                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
+                    item.result(), sequence_types[0], i))
+                code.put_incref(item.result(), item.ctype())
         if len(sequence_types) == 2:
             code.putln("} else {")
             for i, item in enumerate(self.unpacked_items):
-                code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (
-                    item.result(), sequence_types[1], i))
+                if sequence_types[1] == "List":
+                    code.putln("#if !CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS")
+                    code.putln("%s = Py%s_GET_ITEM(sequence, %d); " % (

comment_data.body: It probably doesn't really matter but I think the change to `CythonFunction.c is unnecessary. We know exactly where the list comes from and only one thread has access to it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1216,15 +1216,17 @@ static int __Pyx_CyFunction_InitClassCell(PyObject *cyfunctions, PyObject *class
 
     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
         __pyx_CyFunctionObject *m = (__pyx_CyFunctionObject *)
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
+#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS && !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS && !CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES

comment_data.body: These aren't quite the same from an exception handling point-of-view.

```suggestion
    #if CYTHON_AVOID_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFERENCES && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX > 0x030d00b1
```

We should base it on the version of the Limited API it's compiled with rather than the version of Python it's compiled with.

commit.message: Avoid thread unsafe borrowed references under free-threading
Rename flag to THREAD_UNSAFE and add it to buildenv.pyx
Add GetRef variants and use them instead of get+incref
